title: Tesla ordered by jury to pay more than $3 million to Black ex-worker who endured racist abuse
description: Owen Diaz, a former elevator operator at the company's factory in Fremont, won the verdict in a retrial over damages.

title: Dogecoin jumps over 30% after Musk changes Twitter logo to image of shiba inu
description: The price of the crypto token dogecoin spiked 33% on Monday after Twitter replaced its familiar blue bird logo with the image of a shiba inu dog.

title: March's bank failures show options can be tricky even when retail traders pick big winners
description: The trading halt for Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank created hurdles for traders who had bet that the stocks would fall.

title: Apple's Tim Cook, Disney's Bob Iger to discuss China with lawmakers
description: The chair of the House Select Committee on the Chinese Communist Party has previously said he wants Iger and Big Tech executives to testify before the panel.

title: Trump lands in New York as he prepares to turn himself in on indictment in hush money case
description: Former President Donald Trump has been criminally charged over a 2016 hush money payment to porn star Stormy Daniels by his then-lawyer Michael Cohen.

title: Trump lawyers oppose cameras at arraignment, warn of 'circus-like atmosphere'
description: Donald Trump is due to be arraigned in New York on criminal charges related to paying porn star Stormy Daniels hush money before the 2016 presidential election.

title: Tesla shares drop after deliveries report raises investor concern that more price cuts are coming
description: As Tesla ramps up production in new facilities, some investors worry that reaching the company's ambitious delivery targets will require more price cuts.

title: Google to cut down on employee laptops, services and staplers for 'multi-year' savings
description: Google CFO Ruth Porat made references to the year 2008, when Google made similar cuts to respond to the financial crisis.

title: Harvard expert shares her No. 1 'undesirable' trait CEOs see in employees: It's 'a huge red flag for me'
description: Good bosses prioritize rooting out untrustworthy employees, says Harvard career expert Heidi K. Gardner. Here are the signs they look for, and how to avoid them.

title: Investing app Acorns acquires kid-focused fintech GoHenry to expand in Europe
description: Micro-investing fintech Acorns has acquired child and teen-focused digital banking startup GoHenry to fuel an expansion into Europe.

title: Finland's Sanna Marin, a global progressive icon, loses out on second term after right-wing surge
description: In 2019, Finland's Sanna Marin entered office as the world's youngest serving prime minister at the age of 34.

title: London's priciest townhouse just listed for $74 million. Here's what's hidden beneath it
description: The home is located in the Chelsea Barracks development, a 13-acre parcel of land that sold for more than $1 billion in 2008.

title: China urges Japan not to back U.S. chip export restrictions as Washington tries to rally allies
description: The U.S. has been trying to rally key countries in the semiconductor supply chain, including Japan, around its sweeping chip export restrictions on China.

title: Paris set to ban rented e-scooters after an overwhelming 90% vote for their removal
description: A referendum over the weekend saw Parisians vote to ban rental scooters, but operators argue turnout was low.

title: 'A bad joke': Russia takes the reins of the UN Security Council, to Ukrainian outcry
description: Russia on Saturday assumed the presidency of the United Nations Security Council, even as its own invasion of Ukraine continues to escalate.

title: OPEC+ just made the Fed's job more complicated. Here's why they did it — and what could be next
description: Several OPEC+ members' decision to further cut oil supplies adds to the global challenge of reining in firm inflation rates.

title: Green transition won't be perfect and we'll need natural gas, World Energy Council CEO says
description: "We can't let perfection be the enemy of the good in this, right?" the CEO of the World Energy Council said at a CNBC-moderated discussion.

title: Oil prices surge 8% after OPEC's surprise output cuts; analysts warn of $100 per barrel
description: Oil prices soared as much as 8% on the open after OPEC+ announced it was slashing output by 1.16 million barrels per day.

title: Chinese EV brand Li Auto sees first-quarter deliveries surge by 66%
description: Chinese electric car brand Li Auto delivered more cars in March than Xpeng did in the first quarter, according to company releases.

title: Metaverse could drive up profits — but most businesses may not be ready to invest yet
description: The metaverse has a great potential to drive up business profits but there's a lack of proven success, a survey of industry executives by KPMG showed.
